result.execSummary:
The defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs, all applicable surcharges and assessment and provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge. To be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account from prison sentence defendant is serving on Case 14CF5539; an amount or percentage which the department determines is reasonable. Non payment penalty shall result in a civil judgment

NO operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm and his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (25 pages) commencing 09-15-2016 received and filed. CH

Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 365 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with credit for 365 days time served.  

-Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account from prison sentence defendant is serving on 14CF5539; an amount or percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account from prison sentence defendant is serving on 14CF5539; an amount or percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Sheet

Attorney Eric m Hailstock in court, defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not produced from the custody of the US Marshals office.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed.
Ad Prosequendum signed and filed.
Defendant has signed the paperwork needed to produce defendant from federal custody.  Parties have agreed on a date.  Matter calendared for sentencing.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was indicted in Federal court.  Defendant in Federal custody and has a trial scheduled for either later this year, or early next year.  Court sets matter over for a Status to determine status of defendant's federal case.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for sentencing. Defendant not produced for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in federal custody.  Matter adjourned for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for Tom Potter for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney Hailstock appears as new counsel for the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner not in court, defendant in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney Flanagan failed to notify the SPD office for new counsel for the defendant.    Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 19.

Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for sentencing.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Attorney Flanagan to notify the Public Defender's office. Case adjourned in branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  .
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Court ordered case adjourned for a further proceedings conference in Branch 19.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The previously filed information was not signed.  New information signed and filed. Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Defense requested a status date. Case adjounred to Branch 22.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Asst. District Atty. R. Dague present.  Defense counsel and defendant not in court.
A review of the Information filed during the preliminary hearing reveals that it is not signed by the State.  This to be addressed on the next court date.
Clerk:  jms
Scheduling conference scheduled for 07-29-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in court with Attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in custody.  Ronald Dague, appearing for Thomas L. Potter, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.  Defendant is requesting a preliminary hearing as to this case.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Detective James Henner.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22 for scheduling conference.

All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.
Clerk:  jms
BIHLER & KUEHL, S. C. ATTORNEYS AT LAW.

Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting an adjournment, as defendant may be represented by Attorney Tom Flanagan in this matter, as well as case# 15CF1834.  State did have witnesses present for today's proceedings.  State does not object to an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Ulandas Rezza Turner in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
